title: On the eaten path: 13 restaurants near Buffalo Bayou Park
text:
Photo: Michael Paulsen, Houston Chronicle Image 1 of / 13 13 BRC Gastropub Where: 519 Shepherd Why stop: biscuits with bacon jam and Dixie fried chicken Cost: $$-$$$ Hours: Open 11 a.m.-late Monday-Friday and 10 a.m.-late Saturday and Sunday Patio: yes Pet-friendly: yes Information: 713-861-2233; brcgastropub.com

Image 3 of 13 Sammy's Wild Game Grill Where: 3715 Washington Why stop: venison, pheasant and elk burgers, dogs and more Cost: $-$$ Hours: 11 a.m.-10 p.m. Sunday-Thursday and 11 a.m.-11 p.m. Friday and Saturday Patio: yes Dog-friendly: no Information: 713-868-1345; sammyswildgamegrill.com

Dallas Why go: juicy burgers and cold beer Cost: $ Hours: open at 11 daily Patio: yes Pet-friendly: yes Information: 713-487-0029; refineryburger.com

Where: 1103 S. Shepherd Why stop: sophisticated comfort food at its finest Cost: $$-$$$ Hours: 11 a.m.-10 p.m. Monday-Thursday, 11 a.m.-11 p.m. Friday, 10 a.m.-11 p.m. Saturday and 10 a.m.-9 p.m. Sunday Patio: yes Dog-friendly: no Information: 713-521-2239; backstreetcafe.net

Image 13 of 13 On the eaten path: 13 restaurants near Buffalo Bayou Park 1 / 13 Back to Gallery The 160-acre Buffalo Bayou Park stretches from Shepherd to Sabine streets.
The park will celebrate its grand opening Oct. 3 with a day of activities that include concerts, walking tours, childrenâ€™s crafts and a beer garden.
While event organizers promise the availability of food trucks, you may want to consider taking a lunch or snack break at one of the many restaurants that can be easily accessed -- we're talking walking distance -- from the park
Take a mid-day break and then walk back and find your spot along the bayou for watching the evening's illuminated procession and a fireworks show.
Buffalo Bayou Park Grand Opening When: 1:30-9:30 p.m. Saturday, Oct. 3
Where: 105 Sabine
Information: buffalobayou.org
Browse the slideshow above to see recommended restaurants within walking distance of the park.
